page.title: 07Interesting People 1
page.content: Edward the Confessor born in Islip.King of England.Established Islip's link with Westminster. Beckley,an Islip fisherman,granted the fishing rights of the River Ray by Cromwell for his help at the battle of the bridge in 1645.There is still a Beckley in Islip. Dean Buckland,the pioneer geologist,and Rector of Islip,who is buried here.Also his son Frank who among other things kept and eagle,and a bear which roamed the streets sometimes on horseback. Robert Graves,author and poet,who lived at Worlds End,Collice Street,was a parish Councillor,and played centre forward for the Islip football team in the early 1920's. Professor Gilbert Ryle,Philosopher, lived in North Street in the 1970s.
